medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent abdominal pain and an episode of black tarry stool.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began one month ago, with abdominal pain described as 'off and on', extending from the epigastrium to thighs, occurring almost daily. The pain has been severe at times, described as worse than any other pain the patient has felt. Eating has occasionally improved her pain. She has had a significant decrease in food intake but denies fever and weight loss.
